posts.post_content:
If you were a serious bidder on the 520 SGC set in the Heritage auction, email me directly.  I can save you some $$.

[url]pgellis@comcast.net[/url]

[quote name="pgellis" post=1539100]If you were a serious bidder on the 520 SGC set in the Heritage auction, email me directly.  I can save you some $$.

[url]pgellis@comcast.net[/url][/QUOTE]

did that lot sell? or was it short on reserve
It did not meet the reserve which with BP was over $108,000 I believe.

[quote name="pgellis" post=1539297]It did not meet the reserve which with BP was over $108,000 I believe.[/QUOTE]

I believe it did in fact sell.

[quote name="Peter_Spaeth" post=1539363]I believe it did in fact sell.[/QUOTE]

right i not sure if it we are talking about breaking up the lot..or if its for all cards..didnt want to bother him if it already sold

[quote name="Peter_Spaeth" post=1539363]I believe it did in fact sell.[/QUOTE]

You're correct, it did sell for $108,147.00. Yikes!

[quote name="pgellis" post=1539420]You're correct, it did sell for $108,147.00. Yikes![/QUOTE]

so is the guy selling the set for less than 108k....not sure what you meant of saving  money on it...if it just sold..

OK. Guess I need to clarify....if you were an underbidder, I may be interested in selling my SGC partial set. I'm at 510 and all SGC50 or better including both Demmitt & O'Hara in SGC50. That set that sold had lesser graded Demmitt & O'Hara.
I can send spreadsheet and pricing info if anyone is interested. You could finish the set for close to $20K less than what this set sold for.
